problem: Calculate the value of $(i^{13} + i^{-13} + i^{101})$.
solution: First, simplify the exponents by reducing them modulo 4: $i^{13} = i^{4*3+1} = i^{12}i = 1\cdot i = i$. Next, $i^{-13} = 1/i^{13} = 1/i = -i$ (since $i^{-1} = -i$ by multiplying numerator and denominator by $i$ to get $-i$). For $i^{101} = i^{4*25+1} = i^{100}i = 1\cdot i = i$. Adding these gives $i^{13} + i^{-13} + i^{101} = i - i + i = \boxed{i}$.
